title: What Does the 🥲 (Crying Smile) Emoji Mean?

steps.title: The 🥲 emoji represents a complex mix of emotions.
steps.content: The 🥲 emoji represents a complex mix of emotions. Also called the smiling face with tear emoji, the 🥲 emoji symbolizes a wide range of emotions—including happiness, sadness, gratitude, relief, nostalgia, vulnerability, or a combination of a few! People typically send it when they’re experiencing something bittersweet or smiling through pain. [1] X Research source Sometimes, people use the 🥲 emoji to be sarcastic . If they’re dealing with a negative situation, they might send it to lighten the mood or make themselves feel better.

steps.title: Text the 🥲 emoji to convey you’re stressed or overwhelmed.
steps.content: Text the 🥲 emoji to convey you’re stressed or overwhelmed. Are you really going through it right now? Use the 🥲 emoji to let a loved one know that you have a lot on your plate. Whether it’s due to work, school, or life in general, sharing your feelings can help you relieve stress and boost your overall well-being. [2] X Research source “I can’t deal with work right now 🥲” “I have 4 finals on the same day 🥲” “I’m so anxious about the project 🥲 I hope it goes well 🤞”

steps.title: Use the 🥲 emoji to express relief or gratitude after a hardship.
steps.content: Use the 🥲 emoji to express relief or gratitude after a hardship. If you just completed a difficult task or overcame a huge hurdle in life, celebrate your achievement with the 🥲 emoji. It’s basically the digital version of exhaling a deep breath or holding your hand over your chest—just be sure to thank the other person if they helped you out! “The semester is finally over 🥲 I’m gonna nap for the next 3 days 😆” “We finished the experiment and everything went according to plan 🥲” “Just found out I passed my exam 🥲 Thank you for helping me study ❤️”

steps.title: Send the 🥲 emoji to respond to something bittersweet.
steps.content: Send the 🥲 emoji to respond to something bittersweet. If someone tells you they’re graduating, moving to a new city, or going through a major life change, drop a 🥲 to let them know you’re happy and sad at the same time. It shows that you’re excited for their future but also teary-eyed about what they’re leaving behind. “My sister just got engaged 🥲” “I can’t believe you’re moving to NY this summer 🥲” “OMG, you’re graduating this year? It really is the end of an era 🥲”

steps.title: Use the 🥲 emoji to be humorous during a difficult situation.
steps.content: Use the 🥲 emoji to be humorous during a difficult situation. If things are going downhill in life, send a 🥲 to lighten the mood and keep moving forward. It’s a great way to make light of a negative experience, plus show you’re resilient and don’t take life too seriously. “I got a $100 ticket for fare evasion 🥲” “My car got towed while I was at the mall 🥲🔫” “Just spilled coffee all over my shirt before my presentation 🥲”

steps.title: The 🥲 emoji was approved as part of Unicode 13.0 in 2020.
steps.content: The 🥲 emoji was approved as part of Unicode 13.0 in 2020. Unicode : U+1F972

steps.title: Pair the 🥲 with other emojis to create a fun and unique message.
steps.content: Pair the 🥲 with other emojis to create a fun and unique message. Spice up a standard text message by adding some extra emojis to the mix. Not sure what to send? Here are a few examples to help you get started: 🤰👶🍼🥲 = celebrating a pregnancy 👰‍♀️❤️🤵‍♂️👏🥲 = celebrating a marriage 👪👨‍🎓🥲 = bittersweet about graduating 🎭🥲 = watching a moving performance 📝💯🥲 = relieved about passing a test

steps.title: The 🥲 (crying smile) emoji is just one of many sad and teary-eyed emojis.
steps.content: The 🥲 (crying smile) emoji is just one of many sad and teary-eyed emojis. From the classic crying face emoji to the holding back tears emoji , there are so many ways to express that you’re feeling down. Use any of the following emojis when 🥲 doesn’t convey what you’re trying to say: 😢 (crying face) = sadness or pain 😭 (loudly crying face) = inconsolable grief 😥 (sad but relieved face) = concern or anxiety 😣 (persevering face) = frustration, sadness, helplessness, or struggle 😰 (anxious face with sweat) = sadness, disappointment, fear, or anxiety 🥹 (holding back tears face) = sadness, anger, embarrassment, admiration, or gratitude
